question: William has a herb stand at the town square. He sells three kinds of herbs: orchids, sunflowers and daisies. He usually sells orchids for $3.53 per bouquet, sunflowers for $5.27923076923077 per bouquet and daisies for $5.8580000000000005 per bouquet. William has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If William sells 13 bouquets of orchids, 30 bouquets of sunflowers and 37 bouquets of daisies, how much will he make?
answer:
William will round his orchids up from $3.53 to $4, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
William will round his sunflowers down from $5.27923076923077 to $5, since the number following the 5 is less than 5.
William will round his daisies up from $5.8580000000000005 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
William sells 13 orchids*$4 = $<<13*4=52>>52
William sells 30 sunflowers*$5 = $<<30*5=150>>150
William sells 37 daisies*$6 = $<<37*6=222>>222
Altogether, William will make $52 + $150 + $222 = $<<52+150+222=424>>424
#### 424
